name: places/ChIJlTWmZvdYwokRS2IbtliOLgs
formattedAddress: Hunter Boot Ltd Corporate Office, 57 W 57th St #1702, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: Hunter Boot Ltd Corporate Office, 57 W 57th St #1702, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
Pretty frustrated. I waited for a Black Friday sale and was a little worried that they wouldn’t have my size so last minute I  purchased them before Black Friday, thank god I did.

Black Friday came and they raised the price, by a lot!

Then as I’m waiting for the boots to ship, long after Black Friday the price dropped dramatically! I had to chat with customer service considering they no longer take calls after covid and they wouldn’t credit me the difference with nothing to offer me other than an apology and suggested I return and repurchase.

Hunter was once a great brand that was reputable. Unfortunately the quality and customer service declined.

*UPDATE*
First time wearing them and one of the hooks that holds the laces broke off. I thought the hooks were made of metal. It’s silver plastic.

originalText.text: Atrocious customer service. Super unclear as to what constitutes a promotion vs. an offer vs. a promo code on their website, you can't combine promo codes like the welcome discount with ANY offers (even if they are automatic, like a pair of socks with a boot purchase), and when there are limitations to an offer like color or style they bury the info. Customer service is horrendous and refuses to assist with basic requests. Ended up returning my entire order because the rep refused to honor a refund for one pair of boot socks. Spend elsewhere.

Customer service is horrendous and refuses to assist with basic requests. Ended up returning my entire order because the rep refused to honor a refund for one pair of boot socks. Spend elsewhere.

originalText.text:
Ordered a coat for the holidays (2 weeks in advance) and still have not received my item.
Called Hunter many times and customer service doesn’t know what happened or able to expedite
The shipment. They are also VERY slow in getting back to you on a on-line customer comment.

I have followed up numerous times by phone and email, yet I have NO delivery. I have asked for them to re-order my item and ship priority overnight - NO Reply from Hunter!!!!

Now I see why Target dropped them from their stores! Bad Business!  Bad Partnership! Bad
Company!

Do Not Purchase!!!!

originalText.text: Unfortunately your products do not live up to what the brand history promises. My red pair of classic rain boots have been falling apart (and letting water in!) inside 2 years of infrequent use. Sadly your customer service points to warranty time issues and such avoidance tactics.

text.text: Unfortunately your products do not live up to what the brand history promises. My red pair of classic rain boots have been falling apart (and letting water in!) inside 2 years of infrequent use. Sadly your customer service points to warranty time issues and such avoidance tactics.

originalText.text:
I purchased boots three weeks ago, very excited to get them.  After two weeks nothing shipped. I very nicely contacted customer service, who said they were looking into it with no follow though.  Again, contacted them.  Said I would hear that day.  Nothing.  Basically you have to be a really rude customer for them to actually do something about it.  Not a great customer service model to anger your customers by doing nothing when at the point of frustration you ask them to cancel.  They say they sent it in the mail and then I can return it.  SO BACKWARDS!  I will not support this company.

I requested a cancel.  One person said it wasn’t possible (FYI on their website they can cancel if they want, so it actually is possible).  I then receive an email it’s not possible to cancel NOW because they finally got it together to ship it.

Oh and their compensation- a 25% off my next purchase.  You can guarantee I won’t use it after this horrible customer service.
